msContents.summary: (NL) some lines read:;recto (p. 2), 5-6 [pa];nhgurews;verso (p. 1). 9 amfoterwn; l. 10 ]ous men Ellhnas

msItemStruct.note: Pub. status: right leaf, p. 1-2, Recto + Verso; left leaf, p. 1-2, Recto-verso is unpublished;;under research; contact institution

The papyrus is part of a codex.The recto shows a column from 7 to 8 cm long and about 13 cm wide. At the right of this, there is a portion of a column, from 4 to 5 cm wide, whose writing begins at a point fully a line higher than that of the left column. The upper margin of the fragment varies from 2 to not quite 3 cm. On the verso the narrower column begins similarly at a higher level (or nearly two lines) than the wide column. The title is 1 cm above the wide column of the verso. the writing is in a somewhat uncouth uncial about 3mm. high, and probably belongs to the third century A.D.
Source of description: left leaf, p. 1-2, Recto + Verso is unpublished

p.note: The leaf of the codex titled "peri muthou" is broken off at the bottom and right. The bottom part is P.Palau Rib inv. 155. The left leaf of the codex is broken off at the left and bottom.
